_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Total Distribution, Inc. dba Terminal Warehouse, Inc. located at 1658 Williams Road, Columbus, Ohio is a warehouse storing DOT hazardous and non-hazardous materials. The warehouse is approximately 440,000 sq/ft with roughly 29,000 sq/ft dedicated to the storage of DOT hazardous materials. The section of the warehouse that stores covered materials has berms to prevent any spills/releases from exiting the building. There are no drains in the concrete flooring and spill kits are stored throughout. This section of the warehouse is strictly storage with no repackaging or transloading being done. 



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response

- Terminal Warehouse takes every precaution to prevent the release of chemicals whether it is hazardous or non-hazardous. Its primary focus is on the safety and health of its employees, responders, the general public, and the protection of the environment. 

- An Emergency Coordinator and alternates have been assigned to the facility and are to be contacted immediately should a release occur. The Coordinator, alternates, and all managers and supervisors have received training in response to non-hazardous emergencies and can evacuate the risk exposures. The responding coordinator will evaluate the scene to determine the risk exposures by assessing the type of chemical released and information provided on the Safety Data Sheet. If the release is of a non-hazardous nature, the release, confine and contain it to the immediate area to prevent further migration. If the released material is known to be hazardous or cannot be determined, all employees in the immediate vicinity are to leave the area immediately and notify the Emergency Coordinator and/or Alternate Coordinators.

- Terminal Warehouse employees are not expected or trained to combat extremely hazardous

releases.

- Depending on the applicability and the seriousness of the situation, the responding Coordinator

will:

- Notify assigned team leaders of the emergency.

- Evacuate the immediate area of the release and/or the entire facility should it be necessary.

- Ensure supervisors account for all their employees at the Assembly Area.

- Initiate calls to the appropriate agencies as needed including but not limited to:

* Fire Department

* Spill Removal Service

* County Hazmat

* Ohio EPA Emergency Services

- Ensure the erection of barricades to establish a zone of isolation that prohibits entry.

- Stop the source of the release if it can be done so safely by up righting a drum or plugging a small hole in a drum or tote.

- Use the proper PPE and the Buddy System no matter how small the source of the release.

- Relay accurate information to employees through their supervisors to relieve anxiety.

- If it can be done in a safe manner and proper training has been received the Coordinator and Emergency Response leaders will oversee the cleanup ensuring the use of proper personal protective equipment and cleanup equipment.

- Should the release meet or exceed the reportable quantity the Emergency Coordinator will notify the appropriate agencies as required by law.

- The Emergency Response leaders will determine and announce to all concerned when it is safe to re-enter the building or area.
